googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.earlyVotingNotes: Hawaii is all vote by mail as of 2020, but Voter Service Centers will be open 10 business days prior to and through Election Day for accessible voting, in-person voting, and same-day registration. A list of locations and hours will be posted on  https://elections.hawaii.gov.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.earlyVotingNotesCombined: Hawaii is all vote by mail as of 2020, but Voter Service Centers will be open 10 business days prior to and through Election Day for accessible voting, in-person voting, and same-day registration. A list of locations and hours will be posted on  https://elections.hawaii.gov.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* All Hawaii elections are vote-by-mail.  
* You can still request a one-time absentee ballot if you will be temporarily out of town during a specific election.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You will need a Hawaii ID and a Social Security number to use Hawaii's online voter registration system. If you do not have a Hawaii ID, you can still register to vote by mail.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Voters must provide ID to prove their name, date of birth, residence address and mailing address. Bring your Hawaii driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Hawaii you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of the State of Hawaii
  * be at least 16 years old (you must be 18 years old by Election Day in order to vote)
  * not be incarcerated for a felony conviction
  * not be adjudicated by a court as non compos mentis
